metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14441 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the ICO imagerendering functionality of SDL2_image-2.0.2. A specially crafted ICO imagecan cause an integer overflow, cascading to a heap overflow resulting incode execution. An attacker can display a specially crafted image totrigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14441` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.0+dfsg-3+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-3+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
sdl-image1.2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.14.04.1').
